Topic.Title: Cisco did not pre-announce

Message.Msg: Virtual, I'm a little mixed on your view. I don't think they beat the 5% and here is why. If Chambers comes out and beats 5% growth, as a shareholder I'm going to be more than a little upset about the last 3 months of the shareprice spiraling downward. We lost 25% of our value when Chambers warned of growth 2-5% from the 7% concensus, the sheit will hit the fan if he comes in at 6% growth and we lost all that VALUE in the last 3 months. I do think they will meet or beat the bottom line by a penny and come in at around 4% growth. I think the street will be very happy with that. As usual it will all depend on the outlook, if next quarter continues to look weaker, we are in trouble. I think Chambers says to look for the upper end of 5% growth for next quarter and more optimistic for the remainder of the year. Just my opinion but I will be looking for a spot to sell half my holdings into the run-up over the next 2 weeks and if things look a little brighter on the CC, I will buy HIGHER in the next few days. I think many will be cautious.

Topic.Title: Cisco did not pre-announce

Message.Msg: Cisco makes 10 billion+ in profit a year, has some 30 billion+ in cash, revenue 45 billion+, 70% market share, it even pays a 2% dividend, and yet it behaves like an IPO. This company is Wall Street's dream company. Any other company in Cisco's situation trades above $25 a share (just compare it to Oracle), but Cisco is now at $15. Making money with Cisco here is a no brainer, and I hope Chambers doubles down on politics. This guy is a genius for us traders...

Message.Msg: Cisco adds Marc Benioff and Kristina Johnson which brings the total to 14 members. So why does Cisco need 14 board members and this will add 2 more people who get stock options. 14 board members, what a huge and unwielding mess. The fleecing of the shareholder continues.

Topic.Title: $16.50+ today and $17.01+ tomorrow

Message.Msg: 1st resistance is in the low to mid $16.40's, and strong move through that area should vault us to the $17 area pretty easy. $17's will be a HUGE resistance area and tuff to get through. We will need very good results and a rosy outlook to breach the $17.50's resistance.

Message.Title: Cisco is now trading at the 2008/2009 level
Message.Msg: despite a huge revenue increase (which will increase even more because of the NDS acquisition), more cash they know what to do with it, market share increases in every sector, a 2% dividend, almost a billion less shares, etc, etc, etc if you just discovered Cisco, you are one lucky s-o-b

Topic.Title: Cisco is now trading at the 2008/2009 level

Message.Title: Extra sauce please.
Message.Msg: NEW YORK —Customers across the nation who turned out for Chick-fil-A Appreciation Day were in for a surprise, as the chicken restaurant chose today to launch a new product, Hate Sauce. Delighted customers mobbed the restaurants to try the zesty new sauce, with many chicken fanciers ordering their sandwiches with extra hate. “It’s so spicy it makes your mouth feel like it’s on fire—like a gay couple in hell,” said Harland Dorrinson, who sampled the sauce at a Chick-fil-A in Orlando. But even as Chick-fil-A prepared to call its new hate sauce an instant hit, it faced a challenge from an upstart rival, Wing-n-nuts. The rival chain, based in Falls Church, Virginia, chose today to introduce a new product targeting Chick-fil-A patrons, the Chicken Bacon Bigotwich. “We think we’re going to take a big bite out of Chick-fil-A’s customer base,” said Wing-n-nuts corporate spokesperson Carol Foyler. “Their founder is anti-gay. But ours is anti-gay, anti-immigrant, and anti-woman. When word gets out about that, there’ll be lines around the block.”

Message.Title: Romney Staff admits Romney paid no taxes for 10 years
Message.Msg: The difference there, of course, is that the truth (or lack thereof) of the actual claim was easy to determine. In this case, however, Romney’s refusal to release more than (eventually) two years of tax returns makes that impossible. Also noteworthy is that, when contacted by HuffPo, Romney advisor Kevin Madden didn’t say Reid’s allegation wasn’t true, but that Romney has ”gone above and beyond the disclosure requirements by releasing two years of personal tax returns in addition to the hundreds of pages of personal financial disclosure documents he has provided to the FEC and made public.”

Message.Title: It's not going away Mitt
Message.Msg: he hasn't even released his entire 2010 return. Democrats were quick to wonder why Romney would even engage Reid on the matter, adding another chapter to this bizarre squabble. But that's not particularly fair to the presumptive Republican nominee, who was asked a direct question about the Reid's insistence that an anonymous investor in Bain Capital told him about Romney's zero tax bill. That said, the put-up-or-shut-up line works both ways. Romney could make the whole issue go away (and make Reid look foolish in the process) by simply releasing more tax returns. The campaign showed no willingness to do that, especially under the terms that Reid's established. But that seems likely to just invite even more speculation.

Message.Title: FORBES MAG: WHY LONGTERM UNEMPLOYMENT DOUBLED UNDER OBAMA
Message.Msg: "The media’s fixation on the headline unemployment rate has obscured the soaring number of long-term jobless." The media has focused on prolonged unemployment over 8 percent, while generally downplaying a shocker: the soaring number of people unemployed for more than 6 months. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, back in January 2009 when Barack Obama was sworn in, there were 2.6 million people unemployed for more than 6 months. By June 2012, the ranks of the long-term jobless soared more than 100 percent to 5.3 million. President Obama has promoted long-term unemployment by adopting policies that make it harder and more expensive for employers to hire people. He has relentlessly pushed for higher taxes, higher energy costs, compulsory unionism and, of course, Obamacare. One doesn’t need a Harvard degree to figure out that when government makes hiring more difficult and expensive, there’s likely to be less of it...." Read the rest of the excellent article at forbesdotcom. INCOMPETENT #$%$ Obama MUST be removed from office to save this nation!
